bwwExcerpt: The good news is that these four Broadway losers score: Angie Schworer is the merry epitome of every second-rate Roxie Hart, only leggier. Christopher Sieber makes us believe that Juilliard, indeed, was his career high point - and he's proud of it. Beth Leavel offers an uproarious glimpse of what Liza Minnelli would be if she'd continued performing. And Brooks Ashmanskas somehow manages to be even gayer on stage than ever before.
showScoreExcerpt:
"Emma and Alyssa make a case for why no one, straight or gay, should be forced to live in Indiana. But need the two girls be so dour and dull?...Nicholaw knows precisely want to do with his four ham actors, but leaves stranded the two lesbians and the many bigots surrounding them. His choreography makes this prom one high school dance worth attending. But then you realize youâ€™re watching a bunch of homophobes kick up their heels to have a good time."
